What is North America's largest land animal?
questions.info: Bison are North America's largest land animals. Mature bulls weigh up to 2000 pounds. Bison can run at speeds approaching 35mph!

About how many grizzly bears currently live in the Greater Yellowstone ecosystem?
questions.info: Grizzly bears may weigh up to 800lbs and consume up to 90lbs of food per day in the fall months.
